item.title: The First Dragons
item.description:
These Dragons were the first to be born from Chaos at the beginning of the Age of Chaos. The first to be born of these dragons was Dragunthar, and the only defining property of these dragons was that they were capable of conscious thought. Aside from that, they did not resemble dragons in any way, at least not until dragons began to manipulate the Chaos and hold power over Chaos Magic, which they then used to make more desirable forms for themselves that all other dragons descended from. This is why wyrms, drakes, wyverns, and so on all look somewhat different, as they are all differing descendants of The First Dragons.
“There were 7 Dragons at the beginning of all, and it is said that all life sprung forth from their actions. Were it not for their shows of power, we would have never seen the powerful and fearsome Desecrator Aternos gift our world with unity. Without those improbable statistical wonders, we could not even possess a soul with which to cherish alongside others” — Salgus, upon meeting Havus for the first time.

item.title: Yeva, the Stable Dragon
item.description:
Yeva was one of The First Dragons and became particularly concerned with the loss of what she deemed her friends after Kupaulus was ‘killed’ by Zosciva, resulting in her creation of the Soul.
Her construct of the Soul allowed The First Dragons hasty recovery from their deaths as opposed to taking a lengthy time to reforge their bodies after losing control of the Chaos binding them from fatigue or force. For all other creatures that did not originally forge their body from Chaos and thus do not actively keep themselves bound, such as the future Chaos Dragons, death is more permanent and typically contains one’s energy into their Soul to allow a chance at having a new body be created by either themselves or another. This means Chaos dragons are typically immortal too, though they cannot recycle the same body in most instances, and if no one else helps them and they possess too little Chaos to create a new body, then they are still capable of being killed fully. All future creatures (including Dragons born after the Unification of Magic) simply cannot create themselves a new body at all when in a soul form and thus are mortal in comparison.

item.title: Nexhal
item.description:
“Devourers of Chaos”Nexhal are serpent-like translucent space dwellers. They are born through the death of a Dragon that then does not get reborn (as Dragons are not under the jurisdiction of Surturins, and have also existed long before its creation) and so the mind decays and the Soul erodes its seamless hold on the Magic of the deceased Dragon, thus creating the ethereal form of a Nexhal.
Nexhals have long worm-like bodies that can be seen through and have legs that are formed of two parts and make right angles at their joint (much like how a mantis holds its arms up) that run along the bottom of the creature like a centipede. These legs allow them to walk along Chaos and or the strands of Magic. This means that, though they typically inhabit the zero-gravity realm of space, they still have full movement and within even expending Magic.
Nexhal exclusively eat Chaos in order to sustain themselves, and they prefer to travel in packs if possible. They will also attack any and all creatures that aren’t Dragons in the attempt to convert their forms into raw Chaos. The only way to kill a Nexhal is by disrupting the soul that contains its entire existence. Nexhal are the grotesque and unintended consequence of Yeva’s wish to allow her peers to have hastier recoveries from death.

item.title: Chaos Magic
item.description:
The most untainted magic, but also the most unpredictable. It is capable of anything, as it is forged from and utilizes Chaos. The more Chaos energy you utilize, the more you can accomplish, but without proper control things could go very wrong. With enough Chaos energy that embodies you, or if you were just born with proper control like in the cases of entities like Aternos, then you can begin to control the Chaos Magic more properly, but that weakens it greatly in turn.
Chaos Magic is generally inaccessible to any and all creatures born after the Unification of Magic, save the Prodigies. This is because Chaos energy is only used to form a newly born creature, but then it is unified after that point. Chaos is only used in the initial exchanges, it is no longer a final product to anything other than Chaos Dragons and the Prodigies.Think of Chaos as a flowing river; you can see where it is flowing from and mentally rewind it to see how things came to be, but you cannot reverse the flow of this river. You can easily look to the farther end of the river, maybe swim downstream and make a ruckus, but you cannot swim upstream for the current is too strong. In this way, Chaos Magic cannot affect the past, it can only view the past. However, you could easily affect the future. Time and Chaos, just like space and time, are interwoven and this rule cannot be violated.

item.title: Scramloria (The Sunless Realm)
item.description: (79 DB - 111 DB) Scramloria was created by Xavier alongside the Order of the Eclipse with the goal to give people an escape from magic during the height of the Era of Prosperity. Of course, it was Xavier's secret goal to use it as a place to keep the Prodigy Child away from the rest of the world, and particularly his fellow Bearers of the Egg.Scramloria was ruled based upon the strength of its people. They had a warrior culture that believed only the strongest would have the privilege of commanding others.

item.title: Novum Optimus
item.description: Latin for "new/fresh" and "the best/aristocratic". This is a sprawling empire of magical ingenius led by all members of the Bearers of the Egg save Xavier.

item.title: Navu
item.description:
Means "Dimension" in Dragon Tongue. This is the name given to the floating world that all life typically takes rest upon. Some exceptions to this are Dragons, .
As Navu forms, the farther out you go tends to have more uneven distributions of Chaos coming from the Anomaly and thus biomes like deserts or tundras form from lesser amounts of energy whereas things like forests can form with excess. Dead creatures with a lot of energy or things with a lot of energy in general can form into mountains or glaciers. These glaciers will overtime carve out landscapes like lakes and rivers. Water can generally form too but only as a result of storms that can stir up from heavier fluctuations deriving from the anomaly. Energy that radiates downwards has more pressure on it from what else has been formed and thus typically forms itself more into a rocky form, though it can become minerals or sometimes caves with similar things to the surface layer under proper conditions.
Energy that escapes upwards floats freely and glides across all that has already been created. This allows it to coalesce up higher, either forming clouds, getting trapped in a magical barrier equivalent to an atmosphere, or (in majority) ascends super high and clumps into the equivalent of a sun. This sun object has Chaos flowing into it from different angles, propelling it around so that it revolves around the top side of Navu, meaning Navu never can become pitch dark and only increasingly close to such as the sun is always somewhere off in the distance, it never drops below a horizon or anything. This sun object isn’t quite like our own, and it works in a way where a majority of the light it produces gets cast beneath it in a cone, where as rays originating from higher up it would be progressively dimmer. This is because less chaos energy reaches the higher parts of the object as opposed to the bottom parts. However, the chaos that goes into it and moves it around can also cause it to rotate as an object slightly and can make the brightest parts of the sun aim in different directions than it usually would for some time before it settles to normal.A giant continent in the very center of Navu that holds the Anomaly and houses many powerful creatures due to the aforementioned artifact.

item.title: Magus Optimus
item.description:
An ancient society that thrived upon their usage of Magic. The Proto-Humans that inhabited this sprawling city focused on utilizing Magic to accomplish all their basic needs with as little effort as possible. This included making machines that use Magic in order to create the desired outcomes. However, it was shunned to rely on too much machinery, as Magic was viewed as the superior art form, and thus over reliance was punishable. A group of scholars dared to claim that machinery was an art that would take Magic to even greater heights, but they were all banished to far away lands that were then formed into Arthas.
Magus Optimus, however, ran a long course of history, only ending when they began to gain interest in Draconic Magic. This caused Dragonia to see Magus Optimus as a threat, as they believed that Magus Optimus would stop at no lengths to acquire and harvest Dragons for their own gain. Given Dragonia's relationship with Dragons, they immediately waged war upon Magus Optimus, who despite their great power was not yet ready to fight against Dragons. Dragonia sent many Dragons over, but Siethun was the Dragon that caused the most destruction, and was praised back in Dragonia for this.
The remnants of Magus Optimus became a variety of different smaller nations throughout time, but after the Formation of Draguia, Magus Optimus was reinstated under the name Novum Optimus after they acquired The Egg. They remained a rather small nation until Ovus split The Egg and formed the Bearers of the Egg.Nation that it split into at some point
~4700 DA : Havus journeys the continent of Medrum on the search for powerful mages.~4650 DA : Havus instructs some of the scholars in his party to investigate the sighting of a dragon that supposedly has kidnapped the weak and crippled people in the area.
~4645 DA : These scholars manage to meet with Salgus and a dispute breaks out ending with most of the scholars staying behind with Salgus whilst the others return to Havus.~4643 DA : Some of the scholars return to Havus and inform them that the dragon truly wishes to help people and that the others have stayed behind to study it. Havus instructs them to check up on them in some time but that the dragon was no longer his concern.~4640 DA : Some scholars head out to find Salgus in order to check up on the others that stayed behind.~4635 DA : The scholars find Salgus, commune with the scholars, and return to Havus. They tell of the great knowledge Salgus holds over their own kind. Havus wishes to meet the dragon.~4632 DA : Havus meets Salgus and they become close.
~4629 DA : Havus requests Salgus to inform him on the location of a Chaos Dragon that could teach him how to use Chaos Magic more proficiently. Salgus eventually agrees and takes him to Vokzan due to them being the only Chaos Dragon that Salgus readily knows and that may be willing to help.~4624 DA : Vokzan scoffs at Havus’ attempt to, in Vokzan’s words, “join the ranks of the dragons,” and as such decides to send Havus thousands of years into the future.~4623 DA : In honor of Havus, whom they believed dead, the remaining scholars and mages create a shrine in his honor and build a town around it, as many had no family to return to. This town would be known as Hava.
~4340 DA : Salgus visits a developed Hava and asks if scholars remain in their ranks. Upon confirmation, these scholars meet the preserved scholars within Salganoia. The knowledge imparted on them sparks a renaissance in Hava focused upon scholarly matters.~4270 DA : Hava is visited by a neighboring kingdom and requests help in felling a dragon that has been harassing their kingdom as they have heard that the inhabitants of the town knew much of dragons. The residents of Hava decline leading to a slaughter being led on the village.~4269 DA : Survivors are either enslaved, run away to take up life elsewhere, or are still dedicated to their lifestyle and goals and decide to recreate Hava elsewhere.~4267 DA : A group of surviving mages and scholars of great influence and strength take refuge far away and begin to create a settlement dedicated to mages.~4266 DA : Groups venture out from this settlement to find promising mages, much like Havus had originally done over 400 years ago. However, instead of becoming an adventuring party, they all formed at this settlement now.~4237 DA : The settlement had gone by many names, but it was around this time that it had now been jokingly referred to as Magus Optimus as it was full of very powerful mages.~4186 DA : Across some generations, the name had transcended a mere joke and it became the name of what was now beginning to more so resemble a village of Mages that all now had kids and grandchildren that too were being taught the arcane.~3974 DA : Magus Optimus is officially recognized as a small nation.

item.title: List of All Things
item.description: #hidden This is here to serve as a lookup table for things that exist and possibly when it was invented/discovered and who has possessed or learned or partaken in such things.

item.title: Probot Massacre
item.description: (232 DB) He Who Watches, who had finally begun to feel comfort in their exertion of forces upon the world from their disembodied form, "possessed" an automaton of destruction made in Arthas known as "Probot". It followed that, for the next 3 months, He Who Watches would utilize this device and its tools of mass destruction to lay waste to any evidence of human life that he would come across. At the end, this automaton was destroyed.

item.title: Prodigy
item.description:
The concentration of so many Chaos Dragons into one spot (Zataukeru, Grave of Aternos) caused Chaos energy to behave a little strangely, causing Legyre to create the cycle of the Prodigy. The Prodigy is to be able to harness Chaos Magic so as to keep its flow from going stagnant and clumping around Zataukeru too much.
This is a concept that Legyre had previously played around with before as a proof of concept with the creation of Havus. It should be noted that, the creation of the prodigy then was unrelated to the flow of Chaos and Legyre simply wanted to have fun.Every 10 years after the prior Prodigy has died, Chaos energy will shoot away from Zataukeru and coalesce elsewhere into the formation of the Prodigy.

item.title: Chaos
item.description: A primordial form of energy that holds infinite power. Any reality can spontaneously erupt forth from this energy, and it is the embodiment of all creation, existence, and likelihood. It is with this energy that the first dragon, Dragunthar, was formed. Given that it was but a random occurrence, all of The First Dragons do not look as you would expect a dragon to look necessarily, at least not at first. It wasn't until other horrors were born and fought each other that they began to wonder if they could increase their lethality. Rather than bashing their corporeal forms into each other, some dragons opted to tap into the Chaos surrounding them. Catching onto this, many of The First Dragons began to compete for finding a way to touch the Chaos. The first dragon to manage this connection to Chaos and utilize Chaos Magic, albeit rather poorly, was Unavi.

item.title: Zosciva, the Flaming Dragon
item.description:
Fusion of “Zode” (in Dragon Tongue) for performed (so like Zod-/Zo- for performer people or playful people) and “Lasciva” meaning playful in Latin.
Zosciva was one of The First Dragons and was particularly keen on ‘roughhousing’ with the others by fighting them in magic-less combat.

item.title: Unavi, the Enchanted Dragon
item.description: One of The First Dragons, whose name also means "Demon" in the Dragon Tongue. She was the first dragon to utilize Chaos Magic.

item.title: Vokzan, the Prophet
item.description:
“Vokzan” meaning ‘Future’ in Dragon Tongue.
Vokzan is a Chaos Dragon one of the children of Kupaulus. Vokzan took a great liking to the concept of weaker beings and loved to meddle in their affairs at their request by seeing how different their lives could turn out with foresight.

item.title: Ulnigazi, the Lost Dragon
item.description:
Fusion of “Ulnugazi” and “Ulkige” meaning ‘Hell’ and ‘Race’ in Dragon Tongue respectively, leading to the name of ‘Hell Race’
Ulnigazi was the last of The First Dragons and the Dragon to decide to force particles of Chaos farther apart so that the spontaneous creation of more Dragons was no longer possible. Before the knowledge of how to use Chaos Magic was acquired, some formations were beginning to come along, so Ulnigazi ran away from the other First Dragons to systematically find and exterminate all life forms that were born ‘without his permission’.

item.title: Kupaulus, the Hidden Dragon
item.description:
Fusion of “Kupaudi” in Dragon Tongue (meaning Caution) and “Solus” in Latin (meaning Alone).
Kupaulus was one of The First Dragons who was deemed as a scaredy-cat and often bullied by Dragons both born alongside them and after them. Out of such a deep desire of not being associated with the others, they chose to not conform their body to the acts of reproduction, thus making it so no descendants were ever formed via contraception from Kupaulus and instead were to be willingly made by their decision on few occasions. Kupaulus is also genderless as a result.
There are only a few cases of Kupaulus decided to make an offspring. These moments typically came in bouts of spite or loneliness and would serve as a distraction or tool of revenge. Kupaulus’ first child was Legyre. Third child was Vokzan.Given the mostly solitary nature and the ‘punching bag’ role that Kupaulus often serves to other Dragons, they are not close with many others.
One of Kupaulus’ only friends among The First Dragons is Yeva and they hold a deep hatred for Zosciva. Kupaulus has had many conversations with Grandun before and they hold a respect towards each other for holding somewhat more solitary lifestyles, of course Grandun still is much more active with other Dragons and enjoys interacting with creatures of all types.
Kupaulus was the first creature to ever be killed, however death was not an extremely rigid concept at the time, and so it was more that the Chaos holding Kupaulus in form was disrupted and a long time would need to pass before Kupaulus could interact with the world the same.
This death, which was accidentally (as The First Dragons did not yet know that anything akin to death could occur) caused by Zosciva was greatly devastating in concept to Yeva who created the Soul and gave structure to the Chaos that binds them allowing for death to not take so long to overcome.As an immediate consequence, Kupaulus was able to reform themselves together in a rather short amount of time.

item.title: Anomaly
item.description:
A mystical anomaly found in the heart of Navu that allows the energy of Chaos to neatly form the world sprouting out from it. It is likely that this was either an intended or unintended side effect of the Unification of Magic as it sort of acts like a huge knot between the strands of Magic that permeate outwards from it.It is debatable if the Anomaly is a physical object one could touch or if it is merely akin to a black hole but formed from dense fields of Magic that are untouchable by mortals.
Beings of great power born near the Anomaly are often so interwoven in its strands that they are tethered to either the immediate area or at least just the continent of Medrum.
It is typical that things either born within some distance of the anomaly, or that spend much time in proximity to it, acquire stronger Affinities and other connections like that of the Soul are usually strengthened too.

item.title: Era of Prosperity
item.description:
Immediately succeeding the Formation of Draguia and Human-kind's acquisition of The Egg, the Era of Prosperity began. It is in this sense we begin to see that those who care to record the history of the world from this point onwards is almost entirely composed of humans, as it was seen that no other race showed any signs of prosperity in this time. In a fate much akin to our own world, humans would rape the world of its resources with little concern of any adverse effects to come in the future. As more and more prowess over magic was attained, other lifeforms suffered more and more at the hands of human-kind's exploitation.
It was but only for a couple decades that humans were without a clue of how to exploit the dormant powers within The Egg, but eventually a mage came along who decided to shatter the egg into fragments so that its power could be broken into simpler pieces that were easier to take advantage of. This mage, Ovus, came to be the first Bearer of the Egg as she took one of these fragments and began to distribute the remaining ones to other well-to-do mages. One of these mages, Xavier, came to grow discontent towards the way the world was advancing.
Before Xavier left, there was a roughly 3 year period where the nation that Ovus was from, Magalo reformed into Novum Optimus as the Bearers of the Egg took control as a council to lead the growing nation.
As a result, Xavier stole the current Prodigy from the chambers they were held in in order to seal them away from the rest of the world permanently. This was because the others Bearers were speaking of using the Prodigy to open Zataukeru and bring about the Second Coming of the Dragon Age. To accomplish this goal of sealing them away, Xavier took the Prodigy Child to Dragonia and performed a great spell at the Tower of the Eternal Eclipse alongside likeminded individuals of both great strength (Order of the Eclipse) and of great weakness (Those who would come to inhabit this land). From that moment on, the lands of Dragonia were repurposed into Scramloria. The Prodigy Child, and all other members of the Order of the Eclipse, took refuge deep within Shadow's Peak where they were tasked with guarding the Prodigy.
For a long time, the nation of Novum Optimus took concern in losing one of the Bearers, but with no means of finding where Xavier had gone, they were left only with the option of putting up wanted posters and hoping for the best, and even that proved futile. Many years later, Sintel came across the emanating feeling of Draconic Magic from outside the barrier of Scramloria, and began to be suspicious of what lied within the random dome that had mysteriously appeared over Dragonia 32 years past. This emanating Draconic Magic was of course coming from Siethun who resided within. As a result, Sintel raised this to the other Bearers of the Egg and received permission to siege upon the dome barrier surrounding Scramloria to see what lies within, especially because its formation coincides with the time period Xavier had gone missing.
This of course led to the barrier weakening, allowing Sintel to slip in, battle Xavier, destroy the Tower of the Eternal Eclipse, cause mass panic, create bouts of Nightfall, kill Siethun, reveal the hiding place of the Prodigy Child, and then inevitably die to the hands of Xavier himself. Of course, it was too late for Scramloria, and all residents of the region-save Gareth-perished from a mix of the armies and Nightfall. Additionally, the entire Order of the Eclipse was slain, and Xavier died as a sacrifice when performing the rite that accomplished the Prodigy's Disembodiment. Of course, before doing so Xavier tied a small piece of his own essence to the Tower of the Eternal Eclipse's ruins.
Following the Fall of Scramloria, the Prodigy Child began to slowly gain control over the world even without a corporeal form, which was first manifested through whispering and feelings of being watched leading to the name He Who Watches being coined. This Age ends as soon as He Who Watches had gained enough power to perform the Probot Massacre, thus marking the descent of the world, and the end of the Era of Prosperity.The immediate year following the year the Formation of Draguia took place is recorded as 0 DB (Dragon-Bare). Every subsequent year adds 1 to this number.

item.title: Age of Fatigue
item.description:
It is 232 DB. Many are dead as a result of the Probot Massacre, and The Egg has been in use for about 204 years. The flow of Chaos is compromised and exhibits a polar nature. Due to all these facts, Magic begins to falter. He Who Watches takes advantage of this fact, playing with those that survived his massacre. He banishes the remaining Bearers of the Egg to Deisomnia and fuses back together The Egg as a way to lure people. Novum Optimus as a result begins to fizzle out over the next 2 years as it struggles to form a strong government in a world where the force they are based in the study of, Magic, is turning increasingly weak and obsolete. On another note, with the promise of great power were one to obtain The Egg, He Who Watches began to gain excitement from watching people fight over it and compete for resources, technology, land, and artifacts. Examples of how the entire world was now aware of The Egg can be seen with groups of Humans that partook in the actions of things like the 1st SMP and 2nd SMP. Those examples didn't go too crazy, so He Who Watches will not have cared, but there were also cases where people really fell for his game and became his source of entertainment. One example of this is the events of the 3rd SMP. After around 16 years of He Who Watches playing this game however, Gareth of Ishoria would return to the ruins of Scramloria and his activity would bring about His Weakening. In this period of time, He Who Watches gets angry and tries to find Gareth, but finds his efforts barred due to a mysterious power coming from the destroyed Tower of the Eternal Eclipse. This force, of course, was the spirit of Xavier that he had tied to the ruined landmark before dying. In the mean time, Magic starts to come back somewhat as it has been sometime since The Egg was used in its fractured form to abuse its power, though it is still much weaker than it once was. During this time, the 4th SMP would also take place. With He Who Watches now at his weakest, he begins to get desperate, and starts to make small influences all over the world in hopes of creating zealots ambitious enough to come and boost his power either through some form of Oath or by stopping Gareth.It is at this point that the story of the final SMP will take place.
The same year system as the Era of Prosperity is used (DB).

item.title: Age of Chaos
item.description: At the beginning of time-no, even before that-there was Chaos. From this Chaos erupted The First Dragons. Eventually, Unavi managed to tap into the powers of Chaos Magic, which developed into an art that was necessary to master for any dragons or else they would suffer death at the hands of another. These powerful Chaos Dragons only grew more and more powerful as they procreated, as it takes Chaos to form a dragon, and some of the Chaos of the parents would be inherited into the offspring, creating a positive feedback loop. As these dragons became more and more dense with Chaos, they were able to better control the unpredictable nature of Chaos Magic, however, this caused them to generally be weaker in return with what they could manage in these controlled situations. As a solution, a dragon known as Aternos performed an incredibly powerful spell with Chaos Magic that caused the energies of chaos to condense into a variety of different weaker energies that weaved together to create Magic in an event known as the Unification of Magic. This, of course, was only able to be done due to Aternos' increased Chaos Magic control, and the massacre of 20% of Dragon-kind. This massacre was done so that Aternos had enough Chaos energy to actually perform the giant spell that was the Unification of Magic. Once Chaos was split into threads and weaved into the fluid and malleable energy of Magic, the Age of Chaos came to a close.The last year of the Age of Chaos is 0 Cs (Meaning Chaos). Going closer to the dawn of time increases it by 1 for every year./

item.title: Firelash
item.description:
Firelash is a Homunculus created by Yunem with the purpose of being able to always identify Yunem regardless of the inhabited body and formed soul. He utilizes a device attached to his head that acts a conduit for Vessel-Bound Magic to channel the artificial Affinity for fire that makes up his body.
For his creation, his body wasn't physically augmented to anything beyond the capabilities of a normal human. That being said, the belly that Firelash has is extremely armored and can even be made into an incredibly bouncy surface at the will of Firelash, allowing more versatility and defense there than that of a normal human.
There were some kinks in his initial memories that Yunem didn't have time to work out due to an attack launched by the Syndicate of Wraiths upon the village he was staying in. As such, Firelash is a generally more hot-headed and self-absorbed creature that tends to believe his fire Magic is truly his own and isn't reliant on the technology adorned to his body. The only reason he doesn't attempt to test his theory is that he thinks its sick to have fire for hair and come out of his head so he just keeps his status quo that he seems to love too much to abandon.

item.title: Diary of Yunem
item.description: 254 (DB) Granda 9th, The stampede of horses was heard over the horizon. "They're here," I thought. Perhaps this is no time to act as if my life is some story book though, for the Syndicate of Wraiths is upon us. We frantically took to weaponry, but wraiths are no ordinary creatures. To damage a wraith, one must use some form Magic or some form of magically augmented weaponry. I have been in the works on a Homunculus for quite some time now, but I fear they are not yet ready for the world. I'd like to tweak some of their memories, you see. I fear that if I released them now they may turn out a little more hot-headed then I'd like for a future companion. Ever since I discovered I had a cycle of rebirth due to my lineage I have desired to make a creature capable of identifying me regardless of my possession of a new soul and form and to remind me of who I truly am. I suppose I don't have much a choice however, so I suppose today I unveil him. My fire-slinging dad-bod of awesomeness and eternal stability-Firelash.

item.title: Yunem
item.description:
Originally a dragon who lived up to just before the Formation of Draguia where they decided they did not wish to leave Navu. This prompted them to attempt refuge with Humans, however they turned on Yunem and attempted to murder him. Yunem attempted to sacrifice himself in order to retaliate and finally move on, but the circumstances caused a disturbance that saw Yunem awaking 100 hundred years later. In this form, he was known as Thonem once he learned of his previous life as a dragon. They were somewhat angry that they had amnesia over their rebirth, and attempted to seek out a method of connecting their memories once again. In their efforts, Thonem was attacked after only 38 years of living by a group of bandits and ended up losing their life in the process. Thonem then was reborn as Kahrin around another 100 years later, and it was in this life that they successfully learned of their previous identities, and even obtained the memories. He changed his name to Yunem once again after only 19 years, and began to dedicate himself to the creation of Firelash in hopes that they would be able to restore memories and purpose to him if Yunem ever does die and once again rebirth.
In the modern day, Yunem is a Tho-Dragun mage and alchemist with the goal of establishing longevity in their identity.

item.title: Soul
item.description: On the creation of a lifeform, around the same time Chaos is collapsing into an Affinity, a metaphysical object is formed that acts as a sort of gravitational prison for the Magic a creature possesses called a soul. It isn't necessarily gravity, but the magic of a person is bound by some barrier that the soul forms. As magic is the fundamental force that forms all beings, a soul being it's bounding force makes it a rather fundamental part of your identity. Furthermore, when the soul is separated from the body, magic tends to form a stretched hourglass shape having a bulb where the soul is and where the body is. With this, one can technically extend the control of their most potent magic past just the bounds of their soul, but it can place the user at a great risk. If the magic lingering between the soul and body is severed by any manner, the soul cannot return to its body and enters a purgatory-like state where it can roam the world freely but only for as long as the magic it contains hasn't burnt out due to no organic systems refreshing it. If this process completes, a soul is transported to Surturins (however one can opt in to going there early), otherwise, one can become something like a Enwraith in order to sustain themselves and remain in Navu.

item.title: Homunculus
item.description: An alchemical creature forged as a synthetic life-form. They are not necessarily always aware of this fact that they have been made, as memories are able to be forged upon their birth. Homunculi typically struggle with having a properly formed Affinity as the process with which the homunculus was brought into being is different from a typical creature's birth. As such, apparatuses are typically used to allow such creatures access to magic. Otherwise, homunculi can often be gifted with greater strength allowing them a chance in combat even without explicit access to magic. It should be noted that homunculi do not typically possess a Soul unless otherwise fused with them, such as the practice of trying to revive someone through creating them a new body.

item.title: Wraiths
item.description: Enwraiths were not Wraiths by birth, but rather through a ritual in where a Soul can mimic most properties of a wraith in following their practices, such as siphoning other souls for energy.

item.title: Magic
item.description:
The purest form of controlled magics, being the careful weaving of many threads of Chaos into a pure source of magic with easy usage. The weaves interlocked in different manners, allowing for different forms of magic to take root by varying the amounts of which thread clusters you used from the pure magic form.
One manner through which magic can be channeled is by using a scientific device to allow those with more difficulty in using magic to be able to take advantage of whatever lies within them, typically their Affinity. This magic is a type of support that allows the magic of the wearer to take fruition, and often means their magic can only be as strong as the device through which it is channeled by. There is also the added weakness that you are no longer able to utilize this magic if the device is harmed or can no longer run.

item.title: Syndicate of Wraiths
item.description: A grouping of wraiths dedicated to a strategic gaining of control over human villages, cities, and nations in order to assert power and dominion within the world to establish themselves as something other than a creature lesser than what humans are capable of.

item.title: Ovus
item.description: She/herAn accomplished mage and the first Bearer of the Egg.

item.title: Arthas
item.description:
Mechanical city inhabited originally by Dragon-worshipping Humans who were graced by the presence of Grandun, The Great Dragon. Grandun allowed the Humans to partake in an Oath with him leading to the creation of Artificiods.
~2400 DA : Arthas is formed by a group of scholars who had been banished from their homeland, Magus Optimus, with the goal of using machinery and Magic together in perfect unison.~2300 DA : Arthas is attacked by Magus Optimus and is left in ruin as the remaining people are left to pick up the scraps, massively slowing down the speed of progression.~1900 DA : Grandun visits the lands of Arthas in his gear-like form, inspiring Arthans to utilize such designs for their benefits.~1850 DA : Grandun visits once again, this time sleeping and protecting Arthas by coiling his body around it. Grandun enters a great slumber while Arthans begin to inspect his body.~1700 DA : Several complex designs had already been made and put to use, but it is at this time that construction of a prototype Artificiod completes, however they find no way to power it, and begin to analyze the Magics that make up Grandun.
~1630 DA : Grandun completes a nearly 220 year slumber as he wakes to the sight of Arthas having advanced greatly. It is at this time that Grandun makes an Oath with the people of Arthas, and the first Artificiod, Artho, is made.~1600 DA : Grandun departs from Arthas, having changed material designs many times during his slumber, and left in a glimmering glass form.~1400 DA : The Artificiod is perfected and a civil war begins as they make claim to hold rights.~1390 DA : The Artificiods win and are recognized as fully sapient beings by the people of Arthas. However, the rights of Artificiods are still of great debate.~1300 DA : Artificiods hold equal rights to that of Humans.~800 DA : Artificiods begin to out populate Humans.~740 DA : As the numbers of Humans dwindle, they begin to lose their rights within Arthas.~710 DA : After many mini-skirmishes and outrages, Humans are fully stripped of their rights and viewed as lesser than by Artificiods.~680 DA : After 30 years of being used as slaves and for experiments, the Human Exclusion Act is passed and all Humans are either to be outcast or slain.~665 DA : The last Human dies within Arthas. Arthas is exclusively inhabited by Artificiods now, and they are incredibly Xenophobic to all species deemed to have "less intelligence." The only exception is that of Dragons, of course Artificiods still consider themselves superior to most dragons.~630 DA : To prove their superiority, and to advance their magic, Artificiods begin to design devices to kill Dragons with.
~350 DA : The Chaos Backprocessor is invented by the Artificiods.
~330 DA : As both a proof of concept and for the future of Magical development, the Artificiods use the Chaos Backprocessor and fell a Chaos Dragon, albeit one of the youngest ones.~327 DA : The land of Arthas is entirely decimated by several Chaos Dragons. Only that which was underground survived.~190 DA : Arthas finishes developing a new sprawling underground city, and has entirely hidden their presence from the surface.~87 DA : Arthas begins production of automatons in hopes of creating one that can take advantage of a Chaos Backprocessor.0 DB : Artho is re-activated after being excavated from their deep burial site.7 DB : Artho volunteers for a new program to construct humanoid appearing Artificiods for infiltrating Human societies.9 DB : Artho is disguised as a sort of Human, despite still being an Artificiod, and is given several upgrades to their dated design.
23 DB : A search party of several Human-disguised Artificiods discover that the Formation of Draguia had occurred and that The Egg exists.24 DB : Secret development on a way to harvest The Egg's power begins.28 DB : Arthans figure out how to harvest The Egg's power, so they send out Artho once again to find it.29 DB : Artho learns that The Egg has been shattered.31 DB : Artificiods begin work on AI's that do not operate off of physical form like they do.45 DB : Arthans begin to work on their final model of automaton.92 DB : The shell of the final automaton is completed, and now the installation of the Chaos Backprocessor begins.98 DB : The Chaos Backprocessor is installed, but the automaton is not finished until they give it a proper conscientiousness model.119 DB : The method of housing a non-corporeal intelligence is completed by utilizing Chaos energy.123 DB : The final automaton, Probot, is finished as it is installed with a non-corporeal intelligence.134 DB : Development of a super AI begins.
178 DB : The super AI, NAHFL, is completed.
203 DB : He Who Watches possesses the final automaton Probot and the Artificiods realize this and ask the goal of the pseudo-God. When He Who Watches says he intends to kill all living creatures that stand before him, the Artificiods say he is welcome to do so, as they have far surpassed such lowly creatures nearly a millennia ago and could care less what happens to them. The Probot Massacre commences.

item.title: Proto-Humans
item.description: The predecessor to Humans that existed up until at least 2000 years before the Formation of Draguia.

item.title: Surturins
item.description: #via "its like a pit of acid that a soul walks into that sort of burns away memory" "Aivener maintains the pits and lends the byproducts to other branches of the spiritual realm" "its like a brine processing plant but instead of brine its souls" "you choose to go there, like donating your body to science but spiritual""a sort of cyclical purgatory that turns the newly dead into the to-be born""probably other people like technicians and business heads""maybe souls are a limited resource, so maybe the surturins is a way to sell souls to unborn vessels""maybe without it, you have a 5% chance of your child being born without a soul""maybe soul classism"

item.title: Aivener
item.description:
#via full name: Aivener kshev s'remtier
she is a Tho-Dragun
daughter of Kshev (Inkiab) of the Lineage of Arem (s'Remtier)
Stewardess of Surturins.
The s'Remtier line goes back to the Unification of Magic. Arem was a dragon that in fear of being eradicated as a part of the 20% of dragons who died, was forced to quantum-hibernate and eons later reawake as a human. but a human who cannot die in the traditional sense. For example, Tharem (Human Arem/Broken Arem in dragon-language) lived 500 years laying low until they got fatally injured when a village got invaded in a war. Tharem didnt just end, but mutated into Inkiab ("second born son" in a human language where Tharem died). Almost a mellenium later, Inkiab gave way to Aivener who later establishes the Surturins. She was able to do this because everytime a broken dragon-human mutates upon death, the new being gains a small reserve of Chaos Magic that is a fraction of the original Arem's magic. This magic is what Aivener used to create the system by which Humans can elect to send their souls to her for the Surturins.

item.title: Salgus, the Carrier
item.description:
Similar to the Latin of “salus” for “salvation.” A rather powerful Dragon born after the Unification of Magic. He had a propensity to harbor Humans and other lesser races within his pocket dimension. It is very irregular for any Magic using creatures to be able to create pocket dimensions without the aid of Chaos Magic, however Salgus was still able to manage so through having all affinities and a great portion of Magic.
Salgus did not care much for the affairs of the world and the ongoing war against his kind during the Dragon Age and instead opted to either stay within his pocket dimension or to recruit others to join him within. These people that accompanied him were allowed to exit at any time, and it was treated as a reprieve from the world outside. Furthermore, those that wished to carry out diplomatic relations often opted to do so within Salganoia if they could, as it was protected entirely under the rule of a Dragon. Countless artifacts deemed too dangerous were often stolen or brought before the pocket dimension to be stored away from those with a heart full of wrath. There were even many cases of Dragon Historians opting to never leave the pocket dimension and instead remain in contact with Salgus.
Those with access to Chaos Magic can brute force their way into Salganoia, and with great effort most with all affinities could likely replicate these results, albeit with much more difficulty. The only case of someone brute forcing their way in was Havus, The First Prodigy, and this was only due to the knowledge of the location of Zataukeru, Grave of Aternos being known by the scholars within. This action, of course, weakened the original spell and thus it now holds an incompleteness such that upon the death of Salgus, the pocket dimension will flood out from their corpse and desecrate the nearby land.
Salgus, during the Era of Prosperity, often chose to hide away as he saw it mostly obsolete to ask of people to run from their world now that it was seemingly much better off. This doesn’t mean he never explored though, and eventually he ran into Grandun, The Great Dragon, who commemorated Salgus’ capabilities even as a lesser Dragon, and offered an Oath to increase his power, to which Salgus turned down. Instead, Grandun mentioned a society that he had seen flourish over a millennia ago. He told Salgus that there may exist Humans there that would interest him due to their vast intellect. When Salgus visited the area Grandun told him about however, he found nothing but a barren plains. There was, however, one lone Artificiod named Jexus that had been attempting to run from his people, but was scared of what may become of him. As a result, Jexus agreed to enter Salgus’ pocket dimension, despite being unsure of if even that was a safe option.
As time went on, and it became the Age of Fatigue, Salgus often visited the world less, of which he felt guilty. He wanted to visit and offer the world that seemed to need it the most, but he was scared of He Who Watches. After having to deal with Havus, he did not want to summon the wrath of an even more powerful Prodigy. As a result, Salgus is very interested in methods of permanently destroying the Prodigy Cycle, believing it to be unnecessary in maintaining the flow of Chaos when The Egg already seemed to create more than enough flow previously.
Jexus and the Dragon Scholars within Salganoia often work together now making requests to Salgus to allow them out at certain locations for brief periods of time to learn more of how to combat He Who Watches. Upon learning of His Weakening, Salgus went to visit Gareth of Ishoria and now plans to provide him with the proper resources and power that he may need to move forwards. They have also considered creating an Oath with one another, however they would require an artifact to properly channel the Magic of the Oath due to Gareth’s late-stage Magic Sickness.

item.title: Artificiods
item.description:
Artificial men constructed by the Humans of Arthas. They are powered under the placement of an Oath connecting to the Great Dragon, Grandun.
They are an incredibly xenophobic race of creatures, and they firmly believe in their intellectual superiority to all other living creatures. As such, they often won't hesitate to demonstrate their superiority in other manners that they see fit, such as felling a Chaos Dragon.

item.title: Helga, The Elder Goddess
item.description:
Earliest Goddess within Navu, additionally known as the "Sower of Madness." Before the end of the Dragon Age, she fed off the results of failed use of Chaos, and stowed infighting amongst creatures which could wield it in order to create more sources to feed from.
With the end of the Dragon Age, Helga split into 5 separate Goddess', known as the Daughters of The Elder. This was due to the fact that she simply couldn't incite as much misuse of Chaos that was needed to keep her sustained as one whole.

item.title: Adreil
item.description:
Goddess of Adventure within Scramloria. Highly responsible for the number of adventurer's and explorer's within Scramloria, as she has provided visions of great battles and treasure to be found in the area to outsiders. Additionally responsible for the many danger's present with the area, as she pushed many particularly savage creatures to the land, as well as many of the last remaining Dragons.
4th Daughter of The Elder.

item.title: Jexus
item.description: A rogue Artificiod.

item.title: 3rd SMP
item.description:
There was a huge tech mod focus by a majority of the players that got powerful. Additionally, this was the longest lasting of any of the 4 SMPs that have been done. There were many mod changes made throughout its run time, and small bouts of admin abuse. Many of the bases were found along a river that ran from the ocean to a forest and into a mesa. Some others were located on the middle of the ocean and on a plateau in the mountains. There was also a base far away on a mushroom island. There was no real gimmick but there were attempts at lore and roleplay. Specifically, when the egg was obtained it was the goal of some other members to obtain it for themselves. (Done around November 23rd 2022 up till around sometime after March 22nd 2023 with evidence of it having been played on as late as May 29th 2023)Example of how crazy involved I was in the tech aspect with the river and its cliff face in the background.
This was a successful group of Humans that actually had acquired The Egg for themselves. Not only that, but there was significant restoration of infrastructure and technology within the area that this took place in. If it weren't for the nuclear explosions and reactor breakdowns in the area, this could have eventually grown into a well-to-do establishment of humanity. This was the most appeasing course of events for He Who Watches to watch.

item.title: 2nd SMP
item.description:
This SMP was similar to the 1st in the sense that it did not conclude at any late game point. The dragon egg was not obtained, and mostly only overworld progress was made. Similar to the first time, there were factions, but this time mostly only 2-3. There was also a lore document dating back to this point in time, however its lore focuses on more than just dragons being the original species and implies some things ruled different parts of the world with the dragon just happening to be the strongest of them. Here is an attached map that was made during the time we must have played: (Done around May 8th 2022)There were also some custom recipes:








For the sake of current lore, we will now consider this in much the same way we consider the first. This was just a group of Humans who had heard some legends of The Egg but in the end were more concerned about their own lives and building their relations and nations than partaking in He Who Watches' game. This is yet another side story.

item.title: 1st SMP
item.description:
In the 1st SMP done under the Scrambled SMP, the lore was a little different given that it said Dragons terrorized people and pillagers fought back sending them to the End. However, in this iteration the egg was still meant to be a source of power, this will be how it is adapted into our current lore. This was non-modded and we each chose faction names to operate our bases from. There was also supposedly a gimmick on the server being: "The dragon egg could be turned to shards that made things Unbreakable." (Done around December 4th 2021)There were also many custom recipes:














We will consider the events of the 1st SMP as an area of the world where there was a group of Humans curious about The Egg. However, as I don't recall it ever even getting close to obtaining the egg, these people will have eventually grown tired of their goal and have given up. This means the events of the 1st SMP were more akin to a side story, with slight progress being made, but overall the Humans did not succumb to He Who Watches' games.

item.title: Humans
item.description: The evolution of Proto-Humans. They are responsible for many of the actions taken against Dragons as their prowess over technology and a unique mix between it and Magic has led to their fast development as a species.

item.title: Aternos
item.description: The Dragon accountable for the Unification of Magic after slaughtering of 20% of dragon-kind. He also performed the Formation of Draguia spell as an apology to those he killed during the Age of Chaos and to separate the advancing lives of Humans from the fully evolved life of Chaos Dragons.

item.title: Unification of Magic
item.description: Performed by Aternos during the end of the Age of Chaos to fix the unpredictable nature of Chaos Magic by forming Magic. It is in general the most powerful spell that is currently active in the universe, and likely the most powerful to have ever been or to ever be performed. Of course, it required the Chaos energy of about 20% of Dragon-kind which was achieved through their mass slaughtering by Aternos.

item.title: Draguia
item.description: The pocket dimension realm contained within Aternos' bones following the Formation of Draguia at the end of the Dragon Age. A majority of all Chaos Dragons live within Draguia.

item.title: Chaos Dragons
item.description: Dragons that were born before the Unification of Magic and are capable of using Chaos Magic. Most Chaos Dragons live in Draguia following the Formation of Draguia by Aternos, the most powerful of Chaos Dragons.

item.title: Zataukeru, Grave of Aternos
item.description: Zatau meaning "Immortal" and Keru meaning "Shrine" in Dragon Tongue. It can only be accessed through usage of Chaos Magic and houses Aternos. Within Aternos' bones is the pocket dimension realm of Draguia that most Chaos Dragons inhabit.

item.title: Gareth of Ishoria
item.description:
Gareth was born in Scramloria and became the Lord of Ishoria due to his freakish power.
He was about 23 when the Fall of Scramloria occurred. Most who suffered from the effects of Nightfall perished, but Gareth was strong enough to actually survive and, though he had Magic Sickness, he was able to gain Magical capabilities.
After the Fall of Scramloria, he spent about 137 years doing other things learning about the circumstances leading to the death of everyone he had ever known and how to defeat He Who Remains before returning to the ruins of Scramloria and using his knowledge to cause His Weakening.

item.title: 4th SMP
item.description:
This SMP was very involved on the side of having gimmicks. This is the first one to feature something as changing as a magic mod, and it revolved heavily around that when referring to its gimmicks. All of these changes are shown below:These gimmicks were paired with only being able to form teams of players with the following ruling:Point Values (10 points max on a team): 7 - Ali 6 - Ryken 5 - Ryker 4 - Skyler 4 - Blu 3 - Kai 3 - Aidan 3 - Isaac 3 - Chase 2 - Kiley 2 - Via 2 - Game 2 - KianThese values were based off a combo of knowing tech mods, being good at pvp, and just being good at minecraft in general.
Much like all the other times that Humans were tempted by The Egg, but this happened as Magic was coming back. Many Dragons were fostered by these Humans too, but The Egg was still not acquired by this group, making it more of a side story.

item.title: Followers of He
item.description: Those that follow He Who Watches and, in the Age of Fatigue, are encouraged by him to provide himself with strength or to kill his oppressors.

item.title: Dragon Zealots
item.description: People that believe in the Second Coming of the Dragon Age.

item.title: Bearer of the Egg
item.description: Mostly composed of Dragon Zealots, the Bearers of the Egg were those who held a fragment of The Egg and thus had heightened power.

item.title: Second Coming of the Dragon Age
item.description: Many people believe in re-instating an effect closer to the early days of the Dragon Age wherein Dragons are once again let to roam free and would then be allotted more Magic for birth than Humans, thus restoring the Dragons' former glory. This goal would be accomplished by utilizing someone who can perform uses of Chaos Magic, like the Prodigy, and then opening the seal to Zataukeru.
item.guid: remote-blog/Concepts/Second Coming of the Dragon Age.md

item.title: Ishoria
item.description: Part of Scramloria and was a city built entirely upon the water.

item.title: Dragus
item.description: Part of Scramloria and the original capital of the nation of Dragonia. scramloria* lore hereyap yap yap

item.title: Main Timeline
item.description:
#hidden Brief Overview:
Everything will start with the Age of Chaos and advance into the Dragon Age after Aternos' Unification of Magic. In the Dragon Age, Humans fought against the Dragons to gain more magical prowess. At the end of this war, Aternos sacrificed themselves to create a parallel reality known as Draguia housed entirely within Aternos' grave. Aternos created a seal around the tomb that required Chaos Magic to open, making only the Prodigy and Chaos Dragons able to open it. At some point, Xavier, who was a Bearer of the Egg, ran away with the current prodigy-the Prodigy Child-and created Scramloria, a place where magic was unable to be used by anyone other than Xavier himself. Eventually, Novum Optimus laid siege upon Scramloria leading to the Prodigy's Disembodiment. Only about another 100 years later, the Probot Massacre occurs. Shortly after the time that His Weakening occurs, the events of our modern day server will take place.

item.title: Deisomnia
item.description: Latin for "God's dreams." It is a realm that can only be accessed through the permission of the Prodigy Child and is a section of his subconscious that he can lend out to hold physical forms.

item.title: Affinity
item.description:
The magical composition of a creature. Upon birth, when the Chaos energy used to make you collapses into the stable magic it is forced to be under the rules of the Unification of Magic, then the type of variances in how it collapses as Magic lay way for what magics come easiest to you or that can be interacted with by you. For example, this determines what Dragons breathe.
The more Chaos energy you have, then in general the more affinities you were born with (For example, Aternos wields them all and essentially all other Chaos Dragons do as well).

item.title: Arem
item.description: Arem was a dragon during the Age of Chaos who, in fear of being eradicated during the Unification of Magic, quantum-hibernated until a couple millennia later they awoke as Tharem.

item.title: NAHFL
item.description: Super AI with a non-corporeal intelligence invented by the Arthans in the Era of Prosperity. It stands for "Never Allow Human Filth to Live."

item.title: Chaos Backprocessor
item.description: A device invented by the Artificiods of Arthas during the Dragon Age. It allows for conversion of Magic back into pure Chaos energy, allowing for temporary violations of the spell induced by the Unification of Magic beyond the creation of new lifeforms and of the usage of Chaos Magic.

item.title: Artho
item.description: The first Artificiod.

item.title: Grandun, The Great Dragon
item.description:
Grandun is a Chaos Dragon that chose to stay behind instead of joining the others in Draguia upon the Formation of Draguia. Having been alive since before Dragons could even harness Chaos Magic, and being one of The First Dragons, Grandun is a rather powerful figure. Grandun is the ancestor of all wyrm-type dragons, and is known to change their materialistic form every lunar cycle.
Grandun is a rather curious dragon, and he was experimenting with rather intriguing configurations when he came across a clockwork design with which to mold his body from. It was in this form that the people of Arthas first came across Grandun, and they began to worship him. Before Grandun departed and changed forms, the people of Arthas struck up an Oath with him, allowing them to create the Artificiods and have a permanent source of power with which to fuel their most ambitious creations moving forward.

item.title: Dragon Age
item.description:
Following the Unification of Magic, other beings began to be born, and the interwoven pieces of Magic would coalesce into various forms of matter. A floating world began to form, and as time advances, so does its size. This world, Navu, began to be inhabited by all sorts of creations that held different Affinities. Due to the Exchange of Magical Balance, Humans began to grow to a level of strength where they were capable of felling dragons, but they needed the motivation. This motivation came in the form of the realization that the magical composition of Dragons was the most pure out of any lifeform. As such, humans would harvest dragons for advancing their magical technologies and prowess. Humans reached new heights of magical ascension.
Some stronger dragons caught on, but in general humans were hunting dragons to extinction (even if not on purpose) at an alarming rate. Chaos Dragons however, are so far beyond the scope of human power that they didn't exactly care about what was happening, as dragons of the modern world are viewed as weaker and less than by them. In order to keep themselves separate from the modern world, Aternos decided to separate all Chaos Dragons away from the rest of reality by creating a pocket dimension within themselves under the spell induced in the Formation of Draguia. Before fully sealing themselves away, Aternos left behind The Egg so that if things did begin to go south, or if otherwise needed, Aternos could interact with the outside world by hatching a new body from The Egg and rebirthing. Following the Formation of Draguia, humans stole The Egg and began to use it for their own purposes, and the Dragon Age came to a close.The time immediately following 0 Cs is unmarked, as the exact time that the Unification of Magic occurred is unknown in it's exact years. As such, the year that the Formation of Draguia occurred is recorded as 0 DA (Meaning Dragon Age) and going closer to the Unification of Magic adds a year for every year in that direction.

item.title: Tho-Dragun
item.description: Means "broken dragon" in Dragon Tongue. A human with chaos-dragon D.N.A. A Tho-Dragun does not age, nor can one be killed, technically. When a Tho-Dragun is fatally injured, it mutates into a new form with a new soul.

item.title: Whispers of He
item.description: "I heard it again, those sounds.."

item.title: Dragons
item.description: The most magically sensitive race and also the most magically intensive, requiring much more Chaos energy to be formed that other lifeforms.

item.title: Map of Scramloria
Timeline (Original)
Draconic Magic
item.description: A form of Magic that leverages the same power that embodies the Dragon Tongue typically through usage of words from the aforementioned language.

item.title: Tower of the Eternal Eclipse
item.description: Located in the heart of Scramloria, this tower serves as a holding place for a powerful artifact that the Order of the Eclipse put their power together in creating. It uses Draconic Magic to hold together the sheer Magic poured into it in its creation. The spell dictates that all other than Xavier within Scramloria are unable to utilize Magic.

item.title: Mount Daragon
item.description: Aptly named Mountain "Dragon" as Daragon is "dragon" in Dragon Tongue. This was the resting place of Siethun for many eons as Navu had first formed and onwards and is located in Dragonia/Scramloria.

item.title: Dragonia
item.description: A region that was later tainted by the spell housed in the Tower of the Eternal Eclipse and turned into Scramloria (The Sunless Realm). Prior to this, Dragus was the capital of Dragonia.

item.title: Formation of Draguia
item.description: Aternos created from their corpse a pocket dimension, Draguia, that all other Chaos Dragons could live in uninterupted by the modern world. Aternos left behind The Egg and sealed themselves in Zataukeru.

item.title: His Weakening
item.description: He Who Watches's power begins to wane as Gareth begins his activity in the ruins of Scramloria.

item.title: Exchange of Magical Balance
item.description: Dragons take a much greater amount more of Chaos energy to be born, and thus in comparison to other lifeforms they can only exist in much smaller numbers. This is because dragons don't procreate nearly as much as most modern creatures, and so especially as Humans began to be born more and more, the dragon populations took a significant decline. Furthermore, not only was there less Magic so less dragons were born, but the dragons that were born were beginning to have progressively weaker and weaker magic as a result. This allowed for other lifeforms to finally begin to be more powerful than dragons, even if only by numbers.Some dragons began to be born with no affinities, as opposed to having been born almost always with several as in the past.

item.title: Nightfall
item.description: The barrier falling

item.title: Dragon Tongue
item.description: The language used by Dragons. It carries a certain weight to its words as it was forged in the very essence of Chaos itself at the dawn of time during the Age of Chaos.

item.title: Tharem
item.description: Tharem was a Tho-Dragun. They were created from the transformative process of quantum-hibernation by Arem. Tharem lived ~500 years until being fatally injured in a war. This resulted in Tharem's mutation into Inkiab.

item.title: Sintel, Keeper of Halüges
item.description: Halüges meaning "history" in Dragon Tongue.

item.title: Siethun
item.description: A dragon that was worshipped by the people of Dragonia for millennia before being trapped within Scramloria where he would inevitably be killed by Sintel in order to sever the Oath between him and Xavier allowing for usage of advanced Draconic Magic. Siethun took refuge within Mount Daragon.

item.title: Inkiab
item.description: Inkiab, Tho-Dragun, and son of Tharem, lived almost a millennium until he passed away and mutated into Aivener.
